relation: Define the picture settings. More details. Horizontal alignment can be 'l', 'r', or 'c', for left, right and center. Vertical alignment can be 't', 'b', or 'c', for top, bottom and center.
Display the album art bitmap. More details
Use in a conditional to check if album art has been loaded
textBeforeTable: Playlist/Song Info Example for the the %d(N) commands: If the path is "/Rock/Kent/Isola/11 - 747.mp3", %d(1) is "Isola", %d(2) is "Kent"... You get the picture. Third directory from end of file path. %d(3) Second directory from end of file path. %d(2) First directory from end of file path. %d(1) "(avg)" if variable bit rate or "" if constant bit rate %fv File Size (In Kilobytes) %fs File Path %fp File Name (without extension) %fn File Name %fm File Frequency (in KHz) %fk File Frequency (in Hz) %ff File Codec (e.g. "MP3" or "FLAC") This tag can also be used in a conditional tag, %?fc<mp1|mp2|mp3|AIFF|wav|vorbis|flac|mpc|a52|wavpack|alac|aac|shorten|SID|ADX|NSF|speex|SPC|APE|WMA|unknown> The codec
textAfterTable: %pe Total Number of Playlist Entries %pm Peak Meter The entire line is used as volume peak meter. %pL Show the left channel peak meter value. Can also be used in a conditional: %?pL(0|1|2|...|N) . Can also be used as a bar (See #Bar_Tags) %pR Show the right channel peak meter value. Can also be used in a conditional: %?pR(0|1|2|...|N) . Can also be used as a bar (See #Bar_Tags) %pn Playlist Name (Without path or extension) %pp Playlist Position %pr Remaining Time In Song (when used with %if() returns the number of seconds remaining) %ps Shuffle. Shows 's' if shuffle mode is enabled. %pt Total Track Time (when used with %if() returns the number of seconds the track runs for)
